O clássico da Valve está marcando presença com força total na Steam!
Half Life, O FPS premiado que inspirou a criação do Mod Standalone Counter Strike, e fortemente influenciado por DOOM na sua história, mostra que o jogador não pode somente atirar em tudo que se move, mas solucionar pequenos puzzles para poder avançar no game.
Enfrente monstros e soldados que querem te matar, e tente sair dessa vivo, de preferência!
beautiful game, best story game ever played in my entire life. A Valve's classic

After playing through Doom I and II, I decided to pick up Half-Life. I enjoyed a lot of the games story and how it all played out. I have a good portion of problems with the game but most of them just boil down to GoldSrc ageing poorly. There's a mod called Half-Life: Restored that basically restores cut content from the base game.

A couple things I have problems with is the AI, combat, and level design. The enemy AI is amazing. I love how well done the soldiers are. The Spec Ops can go suck my nuts though, those guys are annoying to kill. The team AI is the problem I have. They annoy the shit outta me. For example, lets say one of the guards are getting attacked, they just stand there and shoot at it. They don't even take cover just stand there right in the line of fire! Idiots! The combat gets really annoying at times. Freeman reloads way to slowly, like, sure Freeman, take your sweet time reloading that shotgun while you're being pelted with machine gun rounds! Taking cover doesn't always work and after mid game, just move around more. The level design gets really annoying late game. You get the long jump way too late in game. Xen is really linear and promotes no exploration at all. The last problem I have with the game is how vague the story is. I still don't understand what the hell a Resonance Cascade is. And whats up with G-Man? I know he's some inter-galactic being that can travel space and time and he's always watching the player (even in Opposing Force, Blue Shift and Decay), but he never really does anything except adjust his tie and talk to you at the end of the game. 

Over all, I give Half-Life a 7.2 out of 10. It's a really good game and I recommend you check it out. I had a lot of fun playing Half-Life and I hope you do too!

ว่างๆเลยลองนั่งเล่นดู
story:ก็โอเคแนว sci-fi ช่วงแรกถึงกลางเน้นsurvivalอะ มาเข้าประเด็นช่วงหลังๆ
gameplay:ก็ยิงๆผ่านไปเรื่อยๆศัตรูหลากหลาย และแต่ละตัวโหดมาก ทำให้ต้องคิดเสมอก่อนรับมือ แต่ที่ชอบคือมันตบกันเองได้ แต่มีฉากแบบนั้นไม่มาก aiติดตามไม่ค่อยคุ้มเท่าไหร่จะรำคาญมากกว่า ปืนโอเคแต่ปืนเอเลี่ยนไม่ค่อยได้ใช้อะ มีแมลงใช้บ้าง
location:สถานที่ช่วงแรกมีเบื่อบ้างวนลูปในท่อ โกดังเดิมๆ 
bugs:เจอ2อัน 1.ภาพดำหลังจบchapter 2.รองบอสอยู่กับที่ แต่แก้ได้หมดนะ
complain:เล่นแบบยากสุดเลย แอบเหนื่อยหน่อยแนะให้กดปุ่มลัดsaveไว้ บางครั่้งautosaveมันอาจเป็นฉากเราตายวนลูปได้ไม่ก็ตกจากที่สูงอะ ไม่งั้นเล่นใหม่แน่ บอสเกมนี้ไม่ยาก แอบรำคาญถ้าโดนมันพาวาร์ปแล้วต้องมากระโดดอะ คือกระโดดยากโว้ย แต่ยากจริงคือก่อนเจอบอส มันต้องผ่านโรงงานเอลี่ยนมั้ง และอยู่กันเยอะจัด ส่วนกระสุนก็น้อยจัดอะ แต่ยังดีที่มีที่ฮีลเยอะพอสมควร
conclusion:ถ้าอยากรู้เรื่องราวเฉยๆ อ่านwikiดีกว่า แต่ประสบการณ์แบบsurvival(แนะนำเล่นhard)มันได้ฟีลจริงๆ

Half life brought many things to the table in 1998 but there are many issues that shine through. The graphics are dated but that is okay, what is not okay is how many enemies blend into the background resulting in you missing constantly, it doesn't help that the crosshair is difficult to see at times. There were also moments were I shot a headcrab that was directly under my shotguns crosshair and I apparently missed. 

Outside of combat there was a lot of moments where I got lost and unsure of what to do. I also had moments where I would get stuck in place and had to load a quick save. 

At this moment I am at the final boss fight but I probably won't finish it. I'll probably view the ending online and move on to Half life 2. 

Again half life was amazing at the time but today I cant say I recommend it if you are looking for a fun time. However if you are interested in seeing a piece of gaming history then this is a great experience!

Однозначно великая игра в истории, которая ознаменовала начало культовой серии Half-Life. 
Конечно для своего времени игра захватывала сюжетом который плавно продолжается в последующих частях и дополняется различными дополнениями. Конечно у первой Халвы плюсов для нашего, 2021 года не так много, но они есть)
Я однозначно рекомендую окунуться в эту серию игр, может и не с первой части, но пройти её хотя бы раз нужно. 
(Русификатор есть на просторах интернета, найти его не трудно)

Первая Half Life понравилось своей  атмосферой, врагами, сюжетом и музыкальным сопровождением. Даже за прошедшие 23 года игра ещё пользуется своей популярностью и спросом. Мне же понравилось это игра из за гемплея и атмосферы, которая не было тогда.

Half-life is a solid FPS. The gameplay progresses at a decent rate, and is fairly well balanced, but that is about all you can say for the game. The cons are that the pacing is erratic, the aesthetics (at least for the first three quarters of the game) are bland and sterile, the story (as praised as it is) is shallow, irrelevant.

But all games have their ups and downs. if you like it non-stop action you might give a chance.

Half-Life is one of my favorite games (and series) of all time. What makes it unique compared to other shooters of the time and even today, is that the combat scenarios are basically little puzzles. You can't just go in guns blazing like most 90s shooters. Each situation requires some planning and use of different weapons, not just your standard smg and shotgun. The way the narrative is told is great as well, instead on cutscenes it's told seamlessly and the camera never leaves the players perspective. The story still holds up as one of the most intriguing and mysterious games stories in history. This is a must play for anyone who has ever touched a PC game.

‣ Game released in 1998.
 Played from – to: (2021-07-09 – 2021-07-14)
‣ 6/10 – A very nostalgic trip.
‣ Game Audio / Soundtrack - 7/10
‣ Atmosphere – 8/10
‣ Main Story / Characters – 9/10
‣ AI – 8/10
‣ Movement – 4/10
‣ Voice acting – 5/10
‣ Combat – 5/10
‣ Final notes: The very first and original Half-Life is a monument in video gaming. Everyone who has ever played this game will probably praise it. And I do agree that this game is legendary and has to be played at least once, however I think some of the gameplay things you have to do have aged poorly. For example movement and platforming can be frustrating and some level layouts can be tricky to maneuver. But the story telling is great and honestly everything that happens in this game is memorable. Combat encounters still seem enjoyable and the graphics even though clearly horrible still have that nostalgic charm. Overall I had good and bad moments with this game, but I still think the good massively outshines the bad.

As much as this game is a piece of history for the shooter genre as a whole it is extremely dated and doesn't feel great to play in my opinion. I'm going to first go into what I liked about the game and then break down what I didn't. As a side note I played and beat it on the hardest difficulty so some of what I say may not apply for lower difficulties.

-Starting strong, I really enjoyed how; for most of the challenges the game throws at you, there are multiple ways of dealing with them, whether they are intended or not. The freedom to choose how to deal with the situation allows you to be creative in your approach, which allows for a more enjoyable time all around. And if you're good at manipulating the game's physics engine it just opens more ways to play. 
-I also love how since the game is old and not very refined, a lot of unexpected things can happen involving entities. In my play-through I saw quite a few headcrabs clip a box I was pushing while lunging and just get catapulted, and it was amazing whenever they did.
-And lastly I enjoyed how I was allowed to murder all the scientists I wanted without worrying about the game really stopping me (most of the time). I had my friend watching me play since he loves the game and his reaction every-time I drew my crowbar when a scientist was talking was great.

I really struggled thinking of what I liked about the game but I wanted to at least include something so it didn't seem like I was just hating the game. I really came into it wanting to know why it was so well regarded. Now let's get on to the negatives.

-Most of the guns in the game are just bad, having either pitiful damage or horrible fire rate (Sometimes both) or ungodly spread. Reload speed is also a big problem I had, I believe it takes like 4-6 secondes to reload the crossbow and the shotgun reloads a single slug per second I think. It might be more like .7 but that's still pretty bad.
-Most enemy has their on bullshit that tends to just be annoying. Human enemies love spamming grenades, Vortigaunts like to hide in dark places and fire their hard hitting blasts at you that does 35-ish damage while you're trying too deal with another enemy and they'll just sometimes spawn in right behind you, the grunts have a homing weapon that fires slow so the tracking is really good and they always come is groups, bullsquids will just spit at you from across the map, and so on.
-As soon as you are spotted by the enemy they all know where you are and the human enemies have hit-scan weapons almost guaranteeing you'll take damage.
-The story is told through random npcs that you may just run by without realizing they were talking in the first place.
-Dialogue is delivered super flat paired with bad audio.
 -The bosses are barely bosses. Until you get to Xen they are literally just, lead boss from area A to area B and hit button. That's if you even decide to fight them because you can just run past most of the time.
-The movement is really floaty which is why you can abuse it so much, but for a casual player who isn't abusing it, it's just annoying and sometimes you'll just walk right off the ledge.
-For half the game you're inside a boring foundation that get's old real quick.
-And finally, the range on explosions are deceptively big, pair that with the human enemies spamming grenades it becomes a bad time.

I'm not saying don't ever play this game, I'm just saying I think people get to hung up on the nostalgia and claim it's better than it is. I'd have to give it like a 4.5/10 as an actual game.

hal fife

This game is great, I have no clue how some people just can't enjoy it (look at negative reviews section). It may be an old game and the graphics might be bad or the physics is annoying, but it is waaaaay more fun than Half-Life2 in my opinion, here you are trying to escape the lab, in Half-Life2 you are just going back and forth doing random stuff (well not really but it feels like that). Now if you really are bored of half life because of "It lacking gameplay (or anything really)" then just use mods, my favourite mod is brutal half life, makes the game waaaay more fun than it already was. So that's my review, Half-Life is great!

Although i hate the current state of Valve; they totally revolutionised gaming more than once in the past so i really kind of still like them.
About the game, it is still playable today and is a great example of how gaming is not just made up of great graphics and sound samples. The humor in this game is top notch and most of what some people call bugs/glitches are left in the game just to make it more fun. Overall, 10/10 thanks for this masterpiece valve.
